name: Fareeha Almas
about: I work at the intersection of accelerator physics and machine learning. Current interests: differentiable beam dynamics, Bayesian experimental design with Fisher information, and practical tools for reproducible research.

education.details: UQ–ANSTO collaboration on differentiable BPM modeling & Bayesian experimental design

education.degree: B.Tech. in Electrical & Electronics Engineering (Minor in Physics)
education.institution: Kakatiya Institute of Technology and Science, Warangal

bullets: Simulating and fabricating efficient grating couplers using FDTD solvers (Lumerical, Tidy3D).

experience.org: Quantum Ecosystems Technology Council of India (QETCI)
bullets: Coordinated programs for training, incubation and investment in Quantum.
Designed membership services and community outreach for multiple demographics.
Led engagement for Quantum Science & Technology Hackathon 2022 (1600+ participants, 50+ mentors).
Authored science communication articles (Quantum ML, Clifford gates).

experience.role: Education Curriculum Disruptor Fellow; Team Lead (Marketing & Innovation); MarComm Group Lead
bullets: Developed Physics/Math curricula leveraging DeepTech content engines and Socratic learning.
Drove zero‑to‑one innovations guided by the Feynman technique and MBO.
Analyzed quantum‑tech impact with the STECH‑IMPACT framework and ethics‑aware reporting.

publications.title: Demonstrating a Fisher Information based method for optimizing BPM placements in AS2
publications.authors: Fareeha Almas, Tessa Charles, Frank Zhang, Benjamin Pope
publications.venue: Submitted to International Particle Accelerator Conference (IPAC) 2025

projects.title: Differentiable BPM Modeling & Optimal Placement (Masters Thesis, UQ–ANSTO)
projects.summary: Autodiff BPM model with Fisher‑information‑driven placement for AS2; sextupole implementation in Cheetah.

projects.title: Entanglement Purification under Depolarising/Pauli Noise
projects.summary: Simulation of purification circuits with Dr. Matthew Winnel; benchmarking under Pauli/depolarising noise.

projects.title: Stability Analysis of UAVs by the Root‑Locus Method
projects.summary: Civil UAV stability derivatives + root‑locus control using real‑time transfer functions via FOMCON & DATCOM.

awards: 2025 Student grants for Algebraic Combinatorics & Quantum Australia conferences (Brisbane).
2025 AINSE Pathway Scholarship (AUD 5000) towards Masters thesis.
2024 Chief Minister’s Overseas Scholarship (INR 2,000,000) by Govt. of Telangana.
affiliations: Member, University Network for Investing and Trading (UQ) (ongoing).
Programme Coordinator, WiE and Vice Chairperson, IEEE KITSW Student Branch (2020–2022).
talks: 2024 Invited talk: Bayesian Experimental Design of Australian Synchrotron 2 beamlines — Australian Synchrotron, Melbourne.
2024 Talk: Squeezing via Dynamical Casimir Effect — Teach at the Beach Student Conference, UQ Optica Chapter.
2024 Fully funded research visit — ANSTO facility, Lucas Heights, Australia.
2024 Panelist: “Women in Quantum” — invited by QETCI.
